intro: Manettia serrata, commonly known as the serrated manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually ovate with serrated edges, contributing to its common name. Manettia serrata is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests.
